Growler117 presents...

'It was around 3 o'clock that afternoon and we felt so screwed, My buddy and I was just standing there waiting to die, and then we see six of these clunky planes dive down firing their rockets. Within a minute the shoreline was on fire and every Kraken that came onto land was killed. I learnt later that week the 104th attack wing flying a dozen KA-8s have saved the island.' -Bobby Kermarski, civilian present during the Second battle of Altay islands.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The KA-8 BACC is a heavily modified variant of the standard Orca acting as a Foward air Controller for other strike aircrafts. The two seat machine carries jamming pods and a complete communication array. The only weapons present on this are a pair of dual .50 calibre turrets.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Both the KA-8B and the BACC feature extensive armor plating on the lower fuselage, this greatly affects the aircraft's rate of climb and handling. Growler Aerospace&Defense strongly recommends flying a full throttle at all times. We are however glad to annonce that a upgrade program for the KA-8B is ready and the craft file will be ready within a week or so.

Download at http://kerbalx.com/Growler117/KA-8E-BACC and http://kerbalx.com/Growler117/KA-8B-Orca
